etymologies: mid 17th century: modern Latin, from Latin mergus ‘diver’ (from mergere ‘to dive’) + anser ‘goose’

definitions: a fish-eating diving duck with a long, thin serrated and hooked bill.

notes.text: Genus Mergus, subfamily Merginae, family Anatidae: six species, including the conspicuously crested red-breasted merganser (M. serrator); common merganser (M. merganser), the male of which has a white body and dark green head

shortDefinitions: diving duck with long thin bill
